item.title: A Clarification About the Same-Origin Policy
item.description: 转自我在 Stackoverflow 的回答: I finally made myself clear after having been struggling half a hour about this saying: Cross-origin writes are typically allowed…. Cross-origin embedding is typically allowed…. Cross-origin reads are typically not allowed… Depending on whether interacting with the server, I’d prefer to classify the same-origin policy into two types, instead of three: reading the already loaded resource of originA from within originB in the browser requesting the remote resource of originA from within originB in the browser The first is the “Cross-origin reads”’s case and the second is the “Cross-origin writes” and “Cross-origin embedding”’s.
